name: SPELLBOUND 2.0
description:
Signature Socials proudly presents
 SPELLBOUND 
An electrifying night of Psytrance • Techno • Progressive
Featuring a Mesmerising Line-Up:
Meraki (AUS) – Special Guest
Ashwynz
 Halinius J
 U-day

Doors at 8pm - Tickets: From $15 - $50

name: NGAHUIA | CICADA | CORDELIA'S
description:
Ngahuia, Cicada and Cordelia's

The hauntingly beautiful music of singer-songwriter NGAHUIA opens the show.
She'll be followed by the raw and ragged brilliance of transsexual disaster folk-rock band CICADA,
before a stunning closing set from feminine rage folk trio CORDELIA'S.

This show's a must-see for anyone who likes their acoustic music intense, ferocious and gay as all hell.

DOORS AT 7:30 - $10 from UTR

id: DAILY KEYNO AND WARM REGARDS-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
name: DAILY KEYNO AND WARM REGARDS
description:
Daily Keyno, the brain child of Mark Sommerville, is proud to announce the release of their debut album, That’s my jc, available on all major streaming platforms starting September 25th.
"That’s my jc is a personal project, featuring 8 tracks that explore themes of love, loneliness, fatherhood, past reflections. The album showcases Daily Keyno’s signature spacious, crystal like guitar, while pushing into new sonic territory.
Warm Regards are a Te Whanganui-a-Tara based country dream-rock band.
They are great mates, and have over 150 years of experience playing in bands and being human beings.
They recently released this song. Listen to it!!
⁦https://open.spotify.com/track/3Sg0WWWoBh8PKSGQ1HdE55?si=anjNyNvaRhqi0Z_eABeFbQ⁩

DOORS OPEN 7:30 - TICKETS $10 from UTR

id: DILLON JO | SOL FIDE | JAYME MORPETH-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
name: DILLON JO | SOL FIDE | JAYME MORPETH
description:
Dillon Jo | Sol Fide | Jayme Morpeth

Dillon Jo Headlining Show (with support from Sol Fide and Jayme Morpeth)

Doors Open 8pm 
Tickets: $10 from UTR

name: SIGIL SOUND: ELECTRIC SWEAT

id: DIESEL JENNY X SYNTHETIC CHILDREN-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
name: DIESEL JENNY X SYNTHETIC CHILDREN
description:
Two of Aotearoa’s most rungle hardware acts are joining forces for a mid-winter tour across the country this July. Armed with new releases and a reckless lack of MIDI cables, longtime pals Synthetic Children and Diesel Jenny are packing gear into the whip for a trip up and down the motu.
Via hardware synths and drum machines, Synthetic Children (Te Papaioea’s Celina Goacher) is bringing bubbly synths, auto-tuned vulnerabilities, and sub-rattling beats. 
Diesel Jenny’s (Pōneke’s Josh Finegan) live set will blend brain-breaking breaks with sugar-rush synths and 3D club energy years. This tour will celebrate the inaugural release of Diesel Jenny’s white label series with a rock-solid RUC-exempt two-tracker.
Ekho Laliah is an Aotearoa based artist who stitches together elements of dream pop, freak folk, and ethereal electronica into sonic tapestries with experimental production as the backbone.
Tickets $15 through UTR or $20 at the door

name: TOWER OF FLINTS / UNDERWIRE
description:
TOWER OF FLINTS + UNDERWIRE

Post-Punk Indie-Rock Wellingtonians Tower of Flints are joined by the mighty Underwire at Valhalla for a night of kick-ass original music with serious attitude!
Doors open early, with Underwire taking the stage at 8pm and Tower Of Flints at 9pm.
The night will be completed with the Dark 80s Disco (tickets sold separately.) A discount will be given to anyone with pre-sales for the Dark 80s Disco.

Doors at 7:30pm | Tickets $15 or $10 with a Dark 80’s Pre-sale

name: KULT PRESENTS: ACT 1
description:
KULT – ACT I 

Enter in the shadows and feel the groove 
This is the first of three KULT events taking place this winter in Wellington, NZ.
Each party will dive into the underground — new artists, evolving sounds and deep energy.
KULT is a tribute to electronic music, a night where local techno artists meet the raw energy of Europe’s rave culture, and where we could all celebrate what matters.
LINE UP:
Open decks  |  Doitz  |  Jacquart  |  U-day

Doors open at 7pm for open Decks
Tickets: EB - $5.50  |  GA - $11

name: DARK 80’S DEBUT AT VALHALLA
description:
THE DARK EIGHTIES CULT 80S HITS DANCE PARTY HITS WELLINGTON
with
DJ KAILEE RAVEN (WELLINGON/AUCKLAND)
DJ PENNIE RAVEN BLACK (AUCKLAND/Director @concordpubanz Host of The Monday 1-4 & ‘Fashun’ on 95bFM) playing
***Get done up, it's more fun!***
Although there is no dress code, we strongly encouraged getting dressed up for your big night out! Big hair, hairspray, loads of 80s style make up, deathrock/batcave style looks, leather, heels, buckles, jewelery, studs, lace, fishnets, eyeliner, black, big boots, Bowie style + new romantics outfits all encouraged! But dress how you feel best! There are no rules about clothing
10:30PM-2AM

DOORS OPEN 10:30  |  TICKETS $10 from UTR
